It is not rated for more than 5m/s, going off the ground, timewarp/physicswarp, or quicksave/quickload.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-13T23:21:12Z" title="04/13/2015 11:21  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 13, 2015</time> by LABHOUSE**
Can you show the treads? They're all covered up!

> 
> Can you show the treads? They're all covered up!

I can't find the link but I think they posted a pic before. They where made from ant engines. And linked? Not sure, a strut?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-13T23:31:30Z" title="04/13/2015 11:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 13, 2015</time> by Majorjim**
  
MCP
Linked with multiple struts. If I remove the covering, the treads come off.
does it actually work as a tread?

> 
> Linked with multiple struts. If I remove the covering, the treads come off.

This is really cool.

 Couldn't you just cover above the two 'jockey'? wheels. Would it still come off? Or does it need to be covered from the side?

It would probably work like that, but it would look a bit odd like that, and not like a tank.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> does it actually work as a tread?

Up until 5 m/s.

> 
> It would probably work like that, but it would look a bit odd like that, and not like a tank.
> - - - Updated - - -
> 
> Up until 5 m/s.

Try adding a second wheel next to the two already there. Set away from the first two so it sandwiches the tread between them.
Ok, I might do that for a mini one of these that is a rover.
Cool this is awesome! I wonder if it works in water....
Did you see the part about it not working when the treads come off the ground?

Awesome! I would imagine this method could be refined and work even better. Gotta start somewhere.

I'm really terrible at building moving contraptions in KSP, so this is really impressive to me.
I got frustrated with mine a long time ago. KSP physics need an upgrade. The colliders too.
